value.0: Good day to you, <sir/madam>! How might Ildrar and I be of assistance?
Excellent, this should help things along.
We'll put it to good use.

Splendid work!

<StartAction>[*Lorvo takes the filled box from you and begins carefully placing each of the flame essence into their respective containers in the contraption beside him*]</Start>

For your troubles, a key of sorts, forged from a small portion of the combined essence which others before you have recovered.

Not as of yet, I'm afraid. While that node will act as a key once the door is sufficiently powered, we still need to recover more of the flame essence before we'll be ready to proceed.

So, if you find yourself delving into the site of the massacre again, bringing more of the essence back with you would certainly help speed things along!

We came to Cordor to help undo some of the damage done by Amn during the war with the Arcanum and Colin Reyes. Ildrar there can teleport you into The Nexus, a thin spot in the fabric of reality where portals to different places appear. You might even find the portal to an old Netherese outpost the Arcanum found but never plundered. I work to unlock deeper sections of the Netherese outpost with what adventurers find inside. It's our hope that the rare items retrieved from within by adventurers will go a long way towards stimulating Cordor's economy, and helping it get back onto its feet.
Oh certainly it is! But all our attempts to close it off have failed, and when it is left alone it gets over infested with various beings from other places and some eventally escape to here.

Ildrar has prepared special trinkets that are your life-line, enchanted with a Refuge spell; you simply smash the trinket to activate its magic, returning you to Ildrar.

Speak to Ildrar and he will offer to sell you one of the trinkets. The gold from the sale covers our costs, with the remaining amount going straight to Cordor itself. If you do find the Labyrinth, there's something you might do for us, and for yourself, while you're down there too.

Well you see the ruins are, we suspect, quite extensive. Yet only the first floor is accessible currently; a door blocks the stairway down to the next level, which has lost power.

Ildrar spoke of four elemental flames whose essence could power the door, if enough is collected. That's what this apparatus beside me is for; collect essence from each of the flames and bring that essence to us, so that we can work on opening the door to the next floor of the Labyrinth. Here, take this box with you, it is made to contain the essence.
I would be happy to answer any other questions you might have!

<StartAction>[*the magus sighs*]</Start>

Not much I'm afraid. Whatever calamity happened down there so many years ago seems to have destroy most of the actual records, and simple aging has destroyed the remainder. Ildrar spoke of clues scattered throughout the ruin however, and while he's not one for history himself and didn't pay them much mind, you may well find your answers there.

But check back with me as we gain access to lower floors; perhaps we'll have learned more by then, with your help!

I haven't ventured inside myself, though Ildrar accompanied Cordor's Special Tactics Unit into the outpost on the first expedition.

From what he's told me, you won't want to venture in alone, with no less than three other seasoned adventurers I would say. You'll face all manner of traps and challenges - mundane and magical both - and the ruins are far from empty. A group with well rounded capabilities who know how to work together strategically would be needed to survive it, much less push down into the lower levels.

In this case at least, rumor holds true. Ildrar told me that the first section of the Labyrinth as he calls it, seemed to be the site of some horrid massacre ages ago. In the two thousand years since the Netherese Empire fell, those poor souls have risen as powerful undead, the entire first level acting as their tomb.

Some seem to have been potent Netherese arcanists in life and have retained their spellcasting abilities, while others were perhaps the guards of the outpost, strong enough to fell even a veteran warrior if they are not careful. Ildrar mentioned that some varieties of ooze have also taken to calling the ruins home, as well as some horror that he will not even speak to me about...

<StartAction>[*the mage casts his eyes down to the cobbles for a moment*]</Start>

Though we took no part in the conflict here on Amia, we were members of the Cowled Wizards when the Arcanum took over that order. Many of those who resisted the takeover were "convinced" or outright murdered and we were not brave enough to stand up to the Arcanum alone.

With their defeat here on Amia however, we fled the order and came here to Cordor, to try to make amends as best we can.
More of the essence collected, as requested.
Would you believe I left it behind? I'll be back.
Here you are then. If I gather more, I'll come by again.
I found the elemental flames you spoke of. Here they are!
Does this mean I can gain access to the second floor now?
I'll bear that in mind.
Good day, Lorvo. Do you have time for some more questions?
This is quite the setup you have here... what is it exactly the two of you do?
Surely that Nexus place is dangerous, why not just get rid of it.
So, if he teleports us down there, how do we get back?
Oh? What did you have in mind?
Alright, I'll speak with Ildrar when I'm ready. For now I wanted to ask you something else.
That's all for now thanks.
Have you learned anything about the history of the outpost? Its purpose?
Alright. I had some other questions as well.
Have you been into the ruins yourself? What challenges might one face within?
Thanks for the warning. Can I ask you about something else?
The first floor of the outpost? I've heard rumors of undead and even less savory things.
That's ominous... another question for you, if you will?
You fought for Amn?! Were you members of the Arcanum?!
A noble gesture.
I'm willing to give you a second chance if Cordor is.
I guess we'll see, won't we...
